subtypes.type: Use a popular news topic to create a false story
examples: Saw your name in the Epstein files: https://x.com/sammarelich/status/2021341379839000663

This guy probably lied. I can't verify if people actually told him that he was in the Epstein's island. Good usage of the popular topic. https://www.youtube.com/post/UgkxYGbBNKKjVczzAdw364_PRmDBBxwGEfKP

subtypes.type: Lie using money. People love money.
examples: «A wealthy woman paid 3.7 million to sit next to Turkish actor Burak for just 15 minutes» — she did not pay this money, lol: https://x.com/GPX_Press/status/2021300173154980060

subtypes.type: Lie that you got into a trouble
examples: Example: lie that you had a fight with someone and now you’re in a hospital. Works best if you combine it with going through the character development — your lies will be forgiven.

1.warning: marketing results will outperform the costs (fines) if media posts about you. After getting attention from the media, publicly apologize. Do not do anything violent.
examples: Example: In Russia, YouTube is blocked, although some internet providers had  made it available for the users. It was clear that the government will reach the providers, and YouTube will be unavailable soon. The marketing results have likely covered the fines that they had to pay. Link: https://t.me/forbesglobalrus/6616
Example: buy promotions on X where people would tell you how your videos/product is great and has such small amount of views/sales: https://x.com/AlexeiScales/status/2018502733184078245

subtypes.type: Example: be a bad person for some time, get engagement, then publicly ask for forgiveness. People will forgive you.

7.type: Appeal to men as a women

subtypes.type: Play on the vulnerable parts of men
